searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. For example, use JSX to create an interactive button: <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: Polling Interval Settings Guide‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 1. Navigate to Polling Settings‚Äã    Navigate to the Upper MenuClick the "All Settings" button  2. Locate the Polling Settings‚Äã    Find the "Polling Settings" button in the middle sectionClick the "Polling Settings" button  3. Default Poll Intervals‚Äã    Default Node Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Interface Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Volume Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Rediscover Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Asset Inventory Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 day‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page  4. Default Statistics & Topology Poll Intervals‚Äã    Default Node Topology Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Node Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Interface Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Volume Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minute‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page

searchDocs.title: üåê Accessing SolarWinds Qcells NMS‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The SolarWinds Network Management System (NMS) for Qcells can be accessed via the following URL:  üîó SolarWinds Qcells NMS  This system allows you to:  Monitor and manage network infrastructure.View performance metrics and real-time alerts.Troubleshoot network issues with in-depth diagnostics.

searchDocs.title: üîπ Accessing SolarWinds Qcells DPA‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Database Performance Analyzer (DPA) can be accessed via the following URL:  üîó SolarWinds Qcells DPA  Features of DPA:  Analyze and optimize database performance.Monitor slow queries and system load.Improve overall database efficiency.

searchDocs.title: üõ† Next Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To get started with SolarWinds Qcells systems:  Ensure you have the appropriate access credentials.Log in using the provided URLs.Refer to the documentation for detailed monitoring and troubleshooting steps.  üîó Related Docs:

searchDocs.title: Copying and Running the Installation Script‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Choose Install via Package Management Tool and click the Next button.Click the item highlighted in the red box and then click the first Copy button (for number 1.).Return to the shell and run the command vi install.sh.Paste the copied code, then type :wq to save it and return to the shell.Run the command chmod 755 install.sh to give execution permission.

searchDocs.title: Running the Installation Script‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 10. Run the command sudo ./install.sh to execute the script. 11. Ensure that you have sudo command authority. 12. Once the script execution is complete, enter the following command: sudo yum clean all && sudo yum -y install swiagent

searchDocs.title: Configuring the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Confirm that the swiagent installation is complete.In the shell, enter the following command: sudo service swiagentd initSelect 2 and enter 10.204.42.7.Select 5 and enter the given password.Select 7 to save the information.Select yes and press Enter.The information is saved, and you return to the shell.

searchDocs.title: Verifying Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 20. To check if the installation is normal, enter the following command: ps -ef | grep swi 21. If the results appear, the installation is successful. 22. The agent runs automatically and will restart even after a system reboot.

searchDocs.title: Confirming in the Web Interface‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 23. Access http://10.204.42.7/Orion/AgentManagement/Admin/ManageAgents.aspx. 24. Enter the Credentials obtained 25. If you see a new entry in the list as shown on the screen, the installation is successful.

searchDocs.title: Step 1: Open the Web Browser‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Go to SolarWinds Agent Download Page.When the login window appears, log in with the given credential.Click the Login button.

searchDocs.title: Step 2: Download and Install the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Select the Windows button and click the Next button.Choose Manually Install by Downloading Files via URL and click the Next button.Click the DOWNLOAD.MSI button, then click the Done button.Locate and open the SolarWinds-Agent.msi file.Click Next to begin the installation.Check the box to accept the License Agreement and click Next.Use the default installation path, then click Next.Click the Install button.When prompted, click Yes to confirm the installation.

searchDocs.title: Step 3: Configure the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Enter the following details when prompted: NMS Server IP Address: 10.204.42.7Orion Server Port: 17778Orion Username/ Password Obtain from the Admin. Click Yes to proceed with the installation.Once the installation is complete, click OK.

searchDocs.title: Step 4: Verify the Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Access the Agent Management page: http://10.204.42.7/Orion/AgentManagement/Admin/ManageAgents.aspx.Enter the Credentials obtainedIf you see the newly installed agent in the list, the installation was successful.

searchDocs.title: Preparations when installing with a user account
Adding a User to the Wheel Group‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Preparations when installing with a user account
searchDocs.content: To add a user to the wheel group, use the following command:  usermod -aG wheel <user id> usermod -aG wheel aylimgr usermod -aG wheel dcuomgr     This command appends the specified user (<user id>) to the wheel group, granting them administrative privileges.

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Here are a few tips you might find useful. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.
